intro: Cryptandra albicans, commonly known as the white cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. It has small, narrow leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
